bham.leakiest.infotheory

Class ShannonEntropy

  • java.lang.Object
    • bham.leakiest.infotheory.ShannonEntropy

  • public class ShannonEntropy
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a library of useful information theory definitions related to Shanon-entropy-based information measure.
    Probability Mass Functions are represented by an array of doubles p(element i) = pmf[i] or by ProbDist class.
    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    Tom Chothia, Yusuke Kawamoto

    • Method Detail

      • conditionalEntropy

        public static double conditionalEntropy(double[] pmf,
                                        double[][] matrix_W)
        Calculates the conditional entropy of a channel matrix given an input PMF.
        N.B. the inputs to this function are a PMF and a Channel Matrix that links that PMF with the other PMF i.e., X and the channel to Y The inputs are NOT two pmfs i.e., H(Q,W) not H(X|Y) matrix_W[input][output] = W(output|input).
        Parameters:
        pmf - PMF array
        matrix_W - channel matrix array
        Returns:
        the conditional entropy of matrix_W given pmf

      • conditionalEntropy

        public static double conditionalEntropy(ProbDist pd,
                                        Channel channel)
        Calculates the conditional entropy of a channel given an input probability distribution.
        Parameters:
        pd - input probability distribution
        channel - channel
        Returns:
        the conditional entropy of channel given pd

        public static double D(double[] p,
                       double[] q)
                throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Calculates the relative entropy of two PMFs p and q. Produces the same result as relativeEntropy(double[] p, double[] q).
        Parameters:

        q - PMF array
        Returns:
        the relative entropy of two PMFs p and q
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - Exception occured by division by zero

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:
        the mutual information between pd and channel

      • jointEntropy

        public static double jointEntropy(double[][] p)
        Calculates the joint entropy of X and Y where p(x,y) = p[x_index][y_index].
        H( (X,Y) ) = - Σ_x Σ_y p(x,y).log(p(x,y))
        Parameters:
        p - the joint probability of X and Y
        Returns:
        the joint entropy of X a d Y

      • KullbackLeibler

        public static double KullbackLeibler(double[] p,
                                     double[] q)
                              throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Calculates the relative entropy of two PMFs p and q. Produces the same result as relativeEntropy(double[] p, double[] q).
        Parameters:
        p - PMF array
        q - PMF array
        Returns:
        the relative entropy of two PMFs p and q
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - Exception occured by division by zero

      • MIuniformInput

        public static double MIuniformInput(double[][] W)
        Calculates the mutual information given an uniform input distribution.
        Parameters:
        W - channel matrix
        Returns:
        The mutual information

      • mutualInformation

        public static double mutualInformation(double[] Q,
                                       double[][] W)
        Calculates mutual information between an input PMF and a channel matrix.
        N.B. the inputs to this function are a PMF and a Channel Matrix that links that PMF with the other PMF i.e., X and the channel to Y. The inputs are NOT two pmfs i.e., I(Q,W) not I(X;Y).
        This method returns I(Q,W) = I(X;Y) = H(X) - H(X|Y).
        Parameters:
        Q - input PMF array
        W - channel matrix
        Returns:
        mutual information between Q and W

      • mutualInformation

        public static double mutualInformation(ProbDist pd,
                                       Channel channel)
        Calculates mutual information between an input PMF and a channel matrix.
        Parameters:
        pd - input probability distribution
        channel - channel
        Returns:
        the mutual information between pd and channel

      • relativeEntropy

        public static double relativeEntropy(double[] p,
                                     double[] q)
                              throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Calculates the relative entropy of two PMFs p and q.
        D(p||q) = Σ_x p(x) log(p(x)/q(x))
        0.log(0/q) = 0 and p.log(p/0) = inf, (we throw an exception rather that return inf)
        Parameters:
        p - PMF array
        q - PMF array
        Returns:
        the relative entropy of two PMFs p and q
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - Exception occured by division by zero
